reviewText: I bought this DVD on a whim being a slight fan of Ben Harper's music (i.e. owning one CD).  This is a great show that shows up perfectly on DVD with great sound and camera work.  The show opens up smashingly with Glory and Consequence, that guitar work by Ben is awesome.  However, my favorite track by far is Amen Omen.  The opening piano is wonderful and the lyrics are beautiful.  Amen also has a couple of great guitar solos;  it is simply a stunning song that I watch it over and over.  Blessed to Witness is another great song.  This DVD is just a great bargain for any audiophile.
Title: N/A

reviewText: how lame life is, my first time seeing Ben is on Austin City Limits, one heck of a show, not just from Ben but at the top of any Austin City show, up there with Stevie Rays last show at ACL.  and the show is closed Captioned, even better.But, you cant buy the DVD to ACL anywhere!!  not on bens site, on PBS, nothing.  I dont want a combined mix of ACL, with other bands, as most of ACL is lame.  well most concerts are lame.  for me, if your not "ON"  then forget it as far as me watching.  having seen hundreds of concerts live and vhs and now dvd, not many will hold a candle worth watching.This Hollywood Bowl, you can tell right awat that Ben is not on, not even close.  He is was to tight and tense.  and the show pretty much never even gets going.  sorry, but it jsut doesnt.  watch ACL and you cant tell the man is "ON"  this night.  Ben always seems to have a nervous energy about him, he is a sweet caring man and shy on stage.  but sometimes that can work wonders for a show, and ACL!  man!  he puts so much soul into that show!  why WHY isnt it aval on DVD>???killer shows you cant get, lame ones you can.  not cool.Listened with Sennheiser 595's, the best that I have found, had 555 for a couple years they are nice too, but cant touch 595's, pay the dif and see, er I mean hear.
summary: C-, cant  touch Austin City Limits show

reviewText: First, this is NOT a review of this dvd... I've only got it on order.  But I need to say:  I've been a fan of his for a couple of years.  This week I saw him in concert at the Fillmore in Denver and was amazed.  I WAS in an altered state of conciousness, but I believe this was one of the best concerts I've ever been to, and I think he's one of the best performers I've EVER seen.  I've been going to concerts since 1968, so I don't say that lightly.He just really kicked butt!
Title: N/A

reviewText: This DVD is saved by its great content. Not only do you get the concert which is great by the way, but you get 2 music video's that are great, I wonder if they were shot by Jack Johnson?, you get an awesome version of "Ground on Down" from soundcheck that is mindblowing. The way he plays those slide guitars are just sick! The only reason I docked it one star was the backstage footage was so boring. All it shows is Ben primping infront of a mirror not saying much. They actually look kinda nerveous. The setlist page is hard to see and navigate through as well. Function over form people!! I will say that it is great to see all of Ben's custom guitars in action.
Title: N/A

reviewText: This is what I've been hoping for for a while now.  A DVD of one of Ben's live performances.  This man has built his reputation based on his live shows, and this one doesn't dissapoint.  The show starts out pretty typical, but Ben's energy and emotion seem to build as the show progresses.  This is a great place to see him perform lots of his classics as well as many of his newer songs from Diamonds on the Inside, and quite honestly I think these songs are better in the live format.  This line-up of the Innocent Criminals is really good, with an organ and a second guitar which leave Ben more space to concentrate on his singing.  Although not as much as before, Ben still is able to showcase his incredible guitar work along side Mark Ford who's style of guitar seems to be strait from the late 60's early 70's.  Now we need to get older shows on DVD also, or a Solo show would be nice.
summary: An excellent show by my favorite artist.
Title: N/A
